definition: to share (a burden, a cost, a responsibility)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to undertake/to carry/to shoulder/to take responsibility
picul (100 catties, 50 kg)/two buckets full/carrying pole and its load/classifier for loads carried on a shoulder pole

sentences.english: I grew up on a farm, helping my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我在农场长大，帮我父母亲分担农务。

sentences.english: Friendships multiply joys and divide griefs.
sentences.chinese: 友谊倍增欢乐，分担悲愁。

sentences.english: Let us share morning dew and cold wave together , share rosy clouds and fog mists .
sentences.chinese: 让我们一起分担朝露和寒潮，共享云霞和雾霭。

sentences.english: Langurs often share babysitting duties within a close-knit group of females and their offspring.
sentences.chinese: 在一个种群内的叶猴们经常互相分担照顾孩子的责任。

sentences.english: B: It’ll be an expensive present, but we can share the cost.
sentences.chinese: 那将是一份昂贵的礼物，但是我们可以分担费用。

sentences.english: Ridesharing can be an ideal way to reduce your personal contribution to pollution.
sentences.chinese: 拼车是降低归你分担的污染的理想办法。

sentences.english: Spend time with friends, and share your grief and heartbreak.
sentences.chinese: 多与朋友交流来分担你的悲伤和心碎。

sentences.english: Colonies operate through organised co-operation and task-sharing.
sentences.chinese: 蚁群通过有组织的合作和分担任务进行运转。

sentences.english: Wei Xu believes that it would hurt his pride to ask a girl to share the cost.
sentences.chinese: 魏叙认为请求女孩分担花销是伤自尊的事。

sentences.english: Could share in that discourtesy of death.
sentences.chinese: 竟会分担那死亡的暴虐无礼。

sentences.english: The countries would share the cost of the move.
sentences.chinese: 美日两国将分担迁址的费用。

sentences.english: The responsibility sharing of architectural accidents is of great legal significance.
sentences.chinese: 建筑事故责任的分担具有十分重要的法律意义。

sentences.english: Part Three, China's current condition of cost-sharing system of civil procedure and the consummations of it.
sentences.chinese: 第三大部分，我国民事诉讼分担制度的现状和完善。

sentences.english: The company also offers job sharing, onsite childcare and, in France, pre-first day training.
sentences.chinese: 公司还提供临时工作分担和办公室育儿室等福利待遇。

sentences.english: He always happy and never shared his parents' worries.
sentences.chinese: 他总是乐呵呵的，从不分担父母亲的忧愁。

sentences.english: I have my share of heartaches, so I call upon His name.
sentences.chinese: 而是有与我分担心痛的，所以我呼求祂的名。

definition: to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
to raise aloft with both hands/(of two or more people) to carry sth together
to carry on one's shoulder/(fig.) to take on (a burden, duty etc)
